title.narrative: CF AND GENDER-RESPONSIVE JUSTICE

description.narrative: Judicial staff and other professionals are qualified to promote and apply child-friendly and gender-responsive justice for all boys and girls, including restorative justice principles for girls and boys in conflict with the law, which contributes to Justice For Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys progressively utilise well governed and accountable child rights coordination and monitoring systems and have equitable access to justice, by 2022.

participating-org.narrative: TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Judicial staff and other professionals are qualified to promote and apply child-friendly and gender-responsive justice for all boysand girls, including restorative justice principles for girls and boys in conflict with the law

description.narrative: ;In close cooperation with the Ministry of Justice, Human and Minority Rights and the highest judicial institutions, i.e. Supreme Court and Supreme State prosecutor’s office, the country ensured further efforts to address both the demand and supply side of children’s equitable access to justice – by strengthening system support and capacities of duty bearers as well as increasing knowledge and capacities of children and families as rights holders | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
